meanings.definition: The state or condition of being unpopular.
meanings.sent1: Her unpopularity among the students was evident when no one wanted to sit with her at lunch.
meanings.sent2: The politician's unpopularity grew as more people disagreed with his policies.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unpopularity, he always had a smile on his face.
meanings.sent4: The unpopularity of the new movie spread like wildfire among the critics.
meanings.sent5: The unpopularity of the team's captain led to a decrease in fan attendance.

meanings.definition: The quality or fact of being disliked or unliked by many people.
meanings.sent1: The unpopularity of the new restaurant was due to its poor service.
meanings.sent2: The singer's unpopularity was a result of his controversial statements.
meanings.sent3: Despite the unpopularity of the idea, they decided to go ahead with it.
meanings.sent4: The unpopularity of the product was a blow to the company's sales.
meanings.sent5: The unpopularity of the fashion trend was evident as fewer people wore it.
